intro: Trichosanthes macrosiphon, commonly known as the large-flowered trumpet vine, is a climbing plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive trumpet shape. The plant produces elongated, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and woody. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
